passages.content: Please choose a difficulty.
Do you wish to see the intro?
The disguise may not use the character's real name.
Did you ask \N[3] for a date?
\N[3]'s Affection for you has increased by 1!

Our story begins with our hero lamenting his poor life choices and lack of success in academics.
Little does he know that soon, those are going to be the least of his problems...

\n(I can't believe I screwed up again.
Guess I really was born a loser.)

\nOh, looks Miss Nele gave me two tickets by mistake.
I hope the Director doesn't notice. I wouldn't want her to get into trouble.
\n<Strange Girl>Well, she's probably too busy with Mr. Daniels to care about it.

\nWhat a nice day it is today! It makes me want to sing!
La, la, la.♫

\n<You>(Wow, that girl's dressed really strangely. She must be headed to 
an anime convention to cosplay or something.)
\n<You>(Wait! She's about to walk in front of a car!)
You quickly grab the distracted cosplayer.
\n<Strange Girl>Aaaahhhhh! What are you doi- Oh! I didn't notice that car!
\n<Strange Girl>You saved me! Thank you, mister!
\n<You>Just call me...
\n<You>Just call me \V[1].
\n<Strange Girl>\V[1]? Oh, it's nice to meet you, \V[1].

\n<\N[3]>I am \N[3]. I'm a Magical Girl who protects everybody's 
happiness.

\n<\N[3]>Yes. I made a deal with a fairy, so now I fight evil creatures 
from another dimension with magic.
\n<\N[3]>...Well, kind of. I'm still a trainee.

\n<\N[3]>But I'm learning really quickly, so I'll become a certified 
Magical Girl in no time.

\n<\N[3]>Yes, I became a Magical Girl because I want to see everyone 
smile.
\n<\N[3]>Cosplay? What's that?

\n<\N[3]>...Say, \V[1], I can sense you are feeling really sad. Can I 
do something to help you?
\n<\N[3]>Sorry, \V[1], but I think that's impossible even with magic.

\n<\N[3]>Sorry, \V[1], but I don't have a phone.
I asked my sisters for one once, but they said I didn't deserve it because I was stupid and useless.
\N[3]'s Affection for you has increased by 1!
\n<\N[3]>Really? You want a date with me?

\n<\N[3]>Oh, this is so embarrassing... but it's okay since you seem 
like a nice person. But I've got to tell you that-\V[15]

\n<\N[3]>Oh no, look at the time! Sorry, \V[1], but I really have to 
get back to camp. Otherwise Miss Nele will be in trouble!

\n<\V[1]>(She ran across the street without even looking...
I guess some people never learn.)
\n<\V[1]>Oh? It looks like \N[3] dropped something.

\n<\V[1]>It's some kind of ticket. It says:
"Magical Camp: The Number One Institute to train Magical Girls!♥"
\n<\V[1]>Huh, is the ticket starting to vibrate-\V[15]
\n<\V[1]>What the fuck? Where the hell am I!?
\n<\V[1]>Huh? The door is open.
\n<\V[1]>(Now let's just hope nobody snitches.)
You use the key to open the door.
\n<Blunt Magical Girl>\N[9] is amazing.
\n<Blunt Magical Girl>What the-?\V[15]

\n<Blunt Magical Girl>\N[2]... you look like a more skimpily-dressed version 
of \N[9].
\n<Blunt Magical Girl>Well excluding the hair, green eyes, and heart pupils.
\n<Blunt Magical Girl>\N[2], your face... You look just like \N[9]!
\n<\V[1]>I can explain...

\nThat's amazing!
I too have been thinking about having some work done to look more like her.

\n<Blunt Magical Girl>Let's both work hard to become living tributes to our amazing 
idol!
\n<\N[9]>Sure, we can go there again.
\n<Energetic Magical Girl>Friends? What happened?
\n<\N[9]>Please don't ask about it. Not now.
\n<Energetic Magical Girl>...Alright.
\n<Energetic Magical Girl>Oh, look \N[9], it's \N[2].
\n<\V[1]>Hi, what are you talking about?

\n<Energetic Magical Girl>We're just trying to decide what to do next time we go out 
to town.

\n<\N[9]>We're thinking of going to this café with a karaoke machine.
The last time we were there, we had a lot of fun.

\n<Energetic Magical Girl>You should've been there. \N[9] has the voice of an angel. 
Do you want to come with us when we go there?
\n<\V[1]>I'm not really much of a singer.
\n<Energetic Magical Girl>How sad, your voice is so lovely.
\n<\N[9]>Yeah, you sound like a cutie!♥ You should totally sing with us.
\n<\V[1]>Fine, I'll consider it.
\n<\N[9]>That's the spirit!
\N[9]'s Affection for you has increased by 1!
\n<\V[1]>But not today, I got stuff to do.
\n<Energetic Magical Girl>That's okay, come to us when you want to.
The girls leave, talking about their other plans.
\n<\V[1]>I really don't want to.
\n<Energetic Magical Girl>Aw she's blushing, how cute!

\n<\N[9]>Okay, fine, no karaoke. I get it. Jeez, you're so difficult 
sometimes!

The girls leave you behind. You get the feeling that \N[9] is angry 
about you declining.

\n<Energetic Magical Girl>Oh, is that because of your voice? Don't worry about it, 
we-\V[15]
\n<\N[9]>...Voice? Oh no, \N[2]'s voice!
\n<\N[9]>Sorry, but I just remembered I promised to show \N[2] around.

\N[9] grabs your arm and drags you to an isolated part of 
the camp.
\n<\N[9]>I can't believe I forgot about something so basic!

\n<\V[1]>\N[979]\N[9]... err... could you just calm down and 
tell me why you're freaking out?

\n<\N[9]>I am\fi freaking out\fr because you sound like a guy trying 
to sound like a girl!
\n<\V[1]>That is, kind of, what I am.
She puts her hands around your neck.

\n<\N[9]>It's a good thing your clothes hide your neck. Your Adam's 
apple would give you away in seconds.
\n<\N[9]>Well, I noticed it in time. Fixing that shouldn't be too hard.
\n<\V[1]>(I'm not sure if I should let \N[979]\N[9] "fix my problem"...)

Your neck suddenly goes completely numb. You try to speak, 
but it seems your vocal cords are paralysed.
\n<\N[9]>Just a little bit more...
\n<\N[9]>And done!

\n<\V[1]>That was weird... Wow, my voice is so high-pitched! It's as 
if I'm breathing helium.

\n<\V[1]>And my neck... It's gone!
My Adam's apple is gone!

\n<\N[9]>Fufufu, my magic took care of that problem together with your voice.
Instead of just casting a spell to change how you sound, I transformed your throat.

\n<\N[9]>That way, since it's not a constant magical effect, it can't be 
dispelled by common counter-magic.
\n<\V[1]>But you can reverse it, right?
\n<\N[9]>Sure, if I want to. But why reverse it? You sound like a cutie.♥
\n<\N[9]>Absolutely!
\n<\V[1]>I really hope you're joking...
\N[9]'s Affection for you has increased by 1!
\n<\V[1]>Wait! Just what are you planning to do, \N[979]\N[9]?

\n<\N[9]>Isn't it obvious? I'm going to fix your voice. Don't tell me 
you don't want my help!?
\n<\V[1]>No, I mean "what exactly are you going to do" to help me?

\n<\N[9]>Oh, right. I'd just change your throat a little so your vocal 
cords produce a higher sound.
\n<\N[9]>And remove your Adam's apple while I'm at it.
\n<\N[9]>I knew you would understand.

Your neck suddenly goes completely numb. You try to speak, 
but it seems your vocal cords are paralysed.
\n<\N[9]>Just a little bit more...
\n<\N[9]>And done!

\n<\V[1]>That was weird... Wow, my voice is so high-pitched! It's as 
if I'm breathing helium.

\n<\V[1]>And my neck... It's gone!
My Adam's apple is gone!

\n<\N[9]>Yeah, I did it to improve your disguise.
And since this is not a constant magical effect, it can't be dispelled by common counter-magic.
\n<\N[9]>What!? But what about your disguise?

\n<\V[1]>Look, \N[979]\N[9], don't take this the wrong way, but I prefer 
to avoid having any more magic change me.

\n<\N[9]>...Dammit, I just want to help! Why do you have to be so 
stubborn!?
Furious, \N[9] leaves.
\n<Energetic Magical Girl>I can hardly wait to hear you sing again, \N[9]!
\n<\V[1]>(Looks pretty demolished. Must have endured a lot of training.)
\n<\N[3]>It's the mailfairy, yay!

\n<\N[3]>Please... stay away from me.
It's for your own safety.
\n<\N[13]>I wonder if I'll get anything today.
\n<Mailfairy>And this letter is for you, \N[13].

\n<\N[13]>Great, another "We are disappointed but we still love you" 
letter from mom. They think I'm still in juvie.
\n<Mailfairy>And here's one for you, \N[3].
\n<\N[3]>It's from mother, no way!
\n<\V[1]>She doesn't write to you often?

\n<\N[3]>She never has... I've written to her every week since 
I came to the camp, but I'd almost given up on her sending 
me an answer.

\n<\N[3]>This is like a dream come true.
Oh, I hope mother has also written about who my father is.
\n<\N[13]>That's great, \N[3].

\n<\N[3]>*Giggle*
My legs are shaking.
\N[3] opens the letter.

\n<\N[3]>It reads:
"To my stupid daughter, stop sending me bothersome letters. For the last time, I don't give a damn about you."
\n<\V[1]>\N[3], that's awful.

\n<\N[3]>It's okay, I should've expected it... Guess I'll stop writing 
letters to mother.
\N[3] runs away with tears in her eyes.
\n<\V[1]>(She's really going through a lot recently.)
\n<\V[1]>(What kind of mother would treat her own daughter like that?)

\n<\N[13]>That\fb bitch!\fr
Mailfairy, do you still have \N[3]'s mother's address?

\n<Mailfairy>Why yes, I do. Are you planning to send her a letter and/or 
package?
\n<\N[13]>Something like that.
\n<\V[1]>What are you planning, \N[13]?

\n<\N[13]>You'll see.
Nobody treats my friends like that and gets away with it!

\n<\N[16]>Hi, you're \N[2], right?
One of \N[9]'s underlings that saved me?
\n<\V[1]>Hi, \N[16]. So, are you enjoying your time at the camp?

\n<\N[16]>Yeah, it's a nice place.
I wish there were more trees, but there are lots of cute girls to ogle.

\n<\N[16]>I just wish more cuties would talk to me, but even though \N[9] put that sign up for me, it didn't end up helping.
And I really wanted to share nature's power with them.
\n<\V[1]>Nature's power?

\n<\N[16]>Yes, I'm trying to get more Magical Girls interested in learning 
nature magic. It's fallen out of fashion lately.
\n<\V[1]>I'll talk to \N[3], I'm sure she'd love to learn it.

\n<\N[16]>\N[3]... Well, she seems to be a good girl, but... uh, 
let's just say she has a black thumb.
\n<\V[1]>Black thumb? Come on, it can't be that bad.

\n<\N[16]>Flowers wilt when she touches them.
That isn't even a metaphor, by the way; she literally kills small plants by just being near them.
\n<\V[1]>What? Are you serious?

\n<\N[16]>She hides it well, but yeah, that girl is like a walking 
wasteland.
\n<\V[1]>What about \N[4]?
\n<\N[16]>Hell no, I can't stand that spoiled bitch!
\n<\V[1]>Then maybe \N[5]?
\n<\N[16]>Not the doll girl, she creeps me out...
\n<\N[16]>What about you, \N[2]?
\n<\N[16]>Sure, why not? I think nature magic would suit you.
\n<\N[16]>Hi, \N[2]. So, are you ready now to learn nature's secrets?

\n<\N[16]>Great!
Come with me, I would prefer to do this somewhere private.

\N[16] grabs your arm and leads you to a normal-looking tree.
She touches the tree and, to your surprise, both of you are absorbed into the trunk.
\n<\N[16]>Take your time, I'll be here waiting.

\n<\N[16]>Hello, \N[2], do you like your newfound connection with 
nature?
\n<\V[1]>Don't you mean my new boobs?
\n<\N[16]>Those too.

\n<\N[16]>Me? You want to know about me? Well, there's not much to 
say, but uh...

\n<\N[16]>I'm a dryad. You know, a type of nature spirit. I live in the 
woods and talk with plants.

\n<\N[16]>I like cute girls and big boobies. Oh, and also cute girls\fi with\fr 
big boobies.
\n<\N[16]>...And I guess that's all there is to know about me.

\n<\N[16]>I met her years ago when she was just starting with work as a Magical Girl.
She saved me from a group of Magicos that were hiding in my forest.

\n<\N[16]>You should've seen her fighting! She was so graceful, it 
was poetry in motion. That day, I fell in love with her.

\n<\N[16]>One day, she'll answer my feelings. Then I'll fill her with 
nature's power and transform my grove into our little love 
nest.

\n<\N[16]>I can't wait to explore every nook and cranny of her body... 
with my tongue.

\n<\N[16]>Obsession!?
I'm not obsessed, I just like boobs.
\n<\V[1]>...But why boobs?
\n<\N[16]>Because boobs are awesome, that's why!
\n<\N[16]>Wait a moment, \N[2].
\n<\N[16]>Don't you want a little more of nature's power?
\n<\V[1]>...Are you trying to expand my breasts again?

\n<\N[16]>But that's only part of it. I\fi am\fr sincerely worried about 
you, \N[2].
\n<\V[1]>You're worried about me? Why?

\n<\N[16]>Because your magic is so much weaker than the other girls'... 
and as far as I can tell, you can't restore your magical 
reserves in any way besides resting.

\n<\N[16]>Those are big handicaps for a Magical Girl, so I want to help 
you.
\n<\N[16]>Because your magic is so much weaker than the other girls'.

\n<\N[16]>That's a big handicap for a Magical Girl, so I want to help 
you.
\n<\N[16]>After all, you helped me first.
\n<\N[16]>And also, you would look better with bigger boobies.
\n<\N[16]>Wait, \N[2]. Have you changed your mind about my offer?

\n<\N[16]>I think you could really use what I'm offering... and also 
the extra magic.
\n<\N[16]>I knew you'd say that.

\n<\N[16]>It's better if we do it in my tree. For some reason, \N[9] 
tends to object to this kind of thing.
\n<\V[1]>(I can't imagine why...)
\n<\N[16]>...I didn't want to do this, but I guess I have no choice.

\n<\N[16]>Oh, \N[2], did you hear about the perverted girl who tried 
to steal panties the other day?
\n<\V[1]>Steal panties...? Wait, you don't mean-\V[15]

\n<\N[16]>I wonder what the other girls will say when they hear about 
this...
\n<\V[1]>...Are you seriously trying to blackmail me?

\n<\V[1]>(Shit! If the others find out about it, they might dig a bit 
deeper and find out the truth about me.)
\n<\N[16]>So, have you changed your mind?
\n<\V[1]>Alright, fine... let's do it.

\n<\N[16]>I'm offering power and boobies for free, but even so you 
say no. I just don't understand...
\n<\N[16]>Hi, \N[2], were you looking for me?
\n<\N[16]>Oh, do you want more of nature's power?
\n<\V[1]>How're you holding up after what happened in the tree?

\n<\N[16]>I'm doing good. Sure, being molested by life-draining mutant 
plants was pretty unpleasant, but it was nothing that smelling 
\N[9]'s underwear could not fix.

\n<\N[16]>The lightning when she caught me hurt a bit, but when she 
was trampling me with those long heels of hers, I got a nice 
view of her panties, so it was alright.

\n<\V[1]>Just checking, \N[16], but you\fi are\fi going to keep my 
secret, right?
\n<\N[16]>You have nothing to worry about, \N[2], my lips are sealed.

\n<\N[16]>I'm very good at keeping secrets, just ask the elementals.
I haven't told a soul that their tree is actually an ark where the last survivors of fallen Farysa are sleeping in a magical stasis until-\V[15]
\n<\N[16]>Please forget I just said that!
\n<\N[16]>Okay, the truth is that I suck at keeping secrets...
\n<\N[16]>Why didn't I think about that before?
\N[16] grabs your chest.
\n<\V[1]>WHAT THE FUCK!?

\n<\N[16]>Mhmmm, I just love your body, my cute \N[2]!
Your BOOBIES and your JUICY VAGINA THAT TOTALLY ISN'T A PENIS, they're great!
\n<\V[1]>...What the hell are you doing?

\n<\N[16]>It's cool, \N[2]. Everybody knows I'm a perverted lesbian, 
so if I molest you in public, nobody will think you're a guy.
\n<\V[1]>Don't do that!
\n<\N[16]>But then how will I keep your secret?
\n<\V[1]>Just keep your mouth shut!

\n<\V[1]>Let me guess:
by more of nature's power, you mean bigger boobs.
\n<\N[16]>Well, not ONLY that!

\n<\N[16]>Your magic seems weaker than the other girls', which is not 
surprising because, well... you know...

\n<\N[16]>Even so, you're fighting Magicos with the other Magical Girls. 
I'm worried that you might tackle something too big for you 
and end up hurt, or worse...
\n<\V[1]>I'm glad you're worried about me, but...

\n<\V[1]>Well... To be honest, this wasn't exactly what I imagined 
my life to be like, but I think I'm getting used to it.
\n<\N[16]>Which includes the boobs, right?
\n<\V[1]>Err... perhaps?
\n<\N[16]>And and...
\n<\V[1]>...but can't you help me without the breast expansion?
\n<\N[16]>But boobs are like really important and magical and...
\n<\N[16]>Errr... let's see...
\n<\N[16]>They'll help blending in with the other girls! ...I guess.
\n<\V[1]>Okay really, now you're just sounding like \N[979]\N[9].
\n<\N[16]>Which means I'm right!
\n<\N[16]>Great, let's go to my tree.
\n<\N[16]>Maybe later then.
\n<\V[1]>Now you're sounding like \N[979]\N[9].
\n<\N[16]>That means I'm right!
\n<\N[16]>Good, let's go to my tree.
\n<\N[16]>Oh... okay then.
\n<\N[16]>I almost forgot!
\n<\N[16]>I have to run, \N[2], I'm late for a thing.
\n<\V[1]>A thing?

\n<\N[16]>Yes, one of those... whatchamacallit?
You know, where you have several nymphs and dryads and we have sex with each other.
\n<\V[1]>An orgy!?
\n<\N[16]>Right, an orgy. I'm late for the orgy.
\n<\N[16]>I would invite you, but you have a... well... you know.

\n<\N[16]>I'll take you to one when you've dropped your "wand", 
alright?
\n<\N[16]>See you later, \N[2].

\n<\N[985]>Are you looking for the dryad that used to hang around here?
Well, you're out of luck. The other day she said that the trees were crying and left.

\n<\N[985]>*Sigh*
And I was really hoping she could help me with my chest.
\n<\N[4]>Good morning, minion, were you looking for me?
\n<\V[1]>I see you're still going with that "minion" thing?

\n<\N[4]>Hmph, clearly you do not understand the honor that comes 
with serving a princess of House Serdak.

\n<\N[4]>Well, I guess it's not your fault. You're just an ignorant commoner 
from some backwater planet, after all.
\n<\V[1]>Oh, do forgive my ignorance.
\n<\N[4]>I don't like your tone, but I will let it slide this time.

\n<\N[4]>Just serve me well and I will make sure that you will be 
handsomely rewarded... despite your abysmal ignorance.
\n<\V[1]>So you're really a princess, \N[4]?
\n<\N[4]>Yes, I'm a vir Imperial Princess.
\n<\N[4]>The name of my species.
\n<\V[1]>Oh, so your father is like the king of the vir?
\n<\N[4]>What!? No! Are you hard of hearing?

\n<\N[4]>I'm an IMPERIAL princess!
My father is the\fi Emperor\fr, not some petty\fi king\fr.
\n<\V[1]>Oh, do forgive me, your highness.
You give \N[4] a mocking bow.
\n<\N[4]>Hmph. Someday, I will have to teach you some manners.

\n<\N[4]>I will let you know that since you are learning to be a girl, 
you should curtsy... Girls don't bow, \N[2].

\n<\N[4]>I will let you know that since you are a girl, you should 
curtsy... Girls don't bow, \N[2].

\n<\N[4]>B-But since you are just an ignorant commoner, I will let you 
keep bowing... consider it a special dispensation.
\n<\V[1]>\N[4]...? Were you just checking out my ass?

\n<\N[4]>N-No...! That's absurd, why would I want to look at another 
girl's body?

\n<\N[4]>And even if I did, I most certainly wouldn't want to look at 
yours.
\n<\V[1]>(Hehehe, now this is just too perfect to let pass.)

\n<\V[1]>(I can't believe I'm about to do this, but it's too perfect to 
let it pass.)

\n<\V[1]>Ooops, I just dropped my wand. Guess I'll have to pick it 
up now~.

You reach toward the wand in a way that lets \N[4] get a 
good look at your ass, and also make sure to wiggle it a bit.
\n<\V[1]>\N[4], are you ok?
\n<\N[4]>Y-Yes...? Why do you ask?
\n<\V[1]>You're bleeding a bit from your nose.
\n<\N[4]>You stupid pervert!
\N[4] runs away, embarrassed.
\N[4]'s Affection for you has increased by 1!

\n<\V[1]>(Ouch! I think \N[4] just stole a chunk of my lifeforce! I guess 
that's her equivalent to a slap.)
\n<\V[1]>So where are you from, \N[4]?
\n<\N[4]>I was born in the Imperial Palace on Itone.
\n<\V[1]>Imperial Palace? Sounds grand.

\n<\N[4]>The palace is the seat of power of the Empire.
All important political, military, and economic decisions are made in its golden halls.

\n<\N[4]>Maybe one day you will be fortunate enough to lay your eyes on it.
I might even let you see the palace's interior, though you will probably have to enter through the servants' entrance.

\n<\V[1]>I haven't seen you hanging out with your friends lately, 
\N[4].

\n<\N[4]>Yes, you're right.
They have been a bit distant lately.
\n<\V[1]>Do you think they figured out what you were doing?

\n<\N[4]>I hope not.
I know this sounds strange, but for some reason, I don't want them to dislike me.
\n<\V[1]>Maybe because you like your friends?
\n<\N[4]>I wonder...

\n<\N[4]>See you in training, \N[2].
I hope the monsters put a up good fight today.
\n<Nele>Ready for your day off, dearie?
\n<Nele>Great, let's just call your friends then.
\n<Nele>Now dearies, are you ready to visit Earth?
\n<\N[3]>Yes Miss Nele, and look...

\n<\N[3]>\N[13] got me some new clothes. She said that these would 
help me mingle better.
\n<Nele>Very nice, \N[3].
\n<Nele>Please don't pick up any of \N[13]'s bad habits.
\n<Nele>What about you girls? Do you have some normal clothes?
\n<Nele>By the way, girls, do you have any normal clothes?

\n<\N[4]>I will go like this; the clothes from Earth are too plain for 
my taste.
\n<\N[5]>I'm going to wear this.
\n<Nele>A sailor fuku? Not something I'd expected from you, \N[5].
\n<\N[5]>I'm full of surprises.
\n<Nele>What about you, \N[2]?
\n<\V[1]>Well... I... you see...
\n<Nele>Is there a problem? Let me see the item you use to transform.
\n<Nele>A makeup box? How classic.
\n<Nele>Funny, it looks just like \N[9]'s with the colours switched...
\n<Nele>Anyway, to change clothes, you do this...
\n<\V[1]>(Change clothes!? What if I end up with my original clothes!?)
\n<Nele>Dearie, have you been going through the Director's stuff?
\n<Nele>Alright. We'll see if we can fix it later.
\n<Nele>Now then, time for your day off.
\n<Nele>Just cross the portal and you'll be transported to Earth.

\n<Nele>Take your time. Like I said before, you can use the tickets 
any time you want.
\n<Nele>Ready for your time off, dearie?
\n<Nele>Let me teleport you to the inn.

\nGood morning, dearie.
I know this is sudden, but we can't leave yet.

\nA girl from a team I counsel, \N[8], has gone missing.
Until she's been found, I cannot in good conscience leave.
\n<\V[1]>I see. Alright, I'll look for her.
\n<Nele>Thank you, dearie.
\n<\N[986]>Oh my, the well seems to have dried up.
\n<\V[1]>Does this mean we're going to have trouble with water?

\n<\N[986]>Not really, I just prefer to get my water directly from the 
well. It reminds me of my village; the water from the cafeteria 
just isn't the same.

Tutorial time!
In this game, days are divided into three parts.

During the first part, you can walk around the camp and 
interact with the other Magical Girls. Some events may 
raise Affection, which can prove beneficial in a variety of 
ways.

The second part begins when you leave the camp to explore
a dungeon. Expect fights against a selection of enemies; each 
Magico has different preferences regarding minions as well as 
their own tactics and tricks.

The last part begins when you leave the dungeon by either 
defeating the Magico, using the exit, or being defeated. It is 
quite similar to the first part, but different people might be 
present during that time.

Try to find a way to escape the camp, or maybe make new 
friends, but remember: do NOT get caught!

\n<\N[10]>*Hic*... oh hi \N[2], do... *hic*... do

Can't you see I'm having a killer

\n<\N[10]>And it's over.
\n<\V[1]>Just like that?

\n<\N[10]>Yes, once I stop drinking, I pretty much
sober up almost instantly, but I still sort
of go through the whole hangover thing.

\n<\N[10]>It's about as bad as a normal hangover,
but compressed into thirty seconds or so.
\n<\V[1]>Sounds bad, why do you even drink?

\n<\N[10]>That's a very good question which I hope
some day to answer.

\n<\N[10]>Fortunately one of the perks of
immortality is that I have time to think
about things.
\n<\N[10]>By the way.
\n<\N[10]>Hello \N[2]. Do you need anything?
\n<\N[10]>Ah, the same question everybody asks.
\n<\N[10]>Yes, I am immortal.

\n<\N[10]>And it's not just the usual kind of
immortality where you don't age, oh no.
As far as I can tell, nothing can keep me
down for long.
\n<\V[1]>That's amazing, how did you...
\n<\N[10]>Stop right there!

\n<\N[10]>I know what you are going to ask, so let
me just say this right now: you don't
want this!

\n<\N[10]>Sure, absolute immortality sounds great
on paper, but let me tell you this: it
hurts.

\n<\N[10]>First there's the physical pain. I heal
quickly, but it still hurts like hell when
I get injured, and as I don't die, wounds
can always get worse.

\n<\N[10]>And then there are the long lonely nights
when I think about all the people I've
lost...

\n<\N[10]>Anyway, even if I knew why I am like
this, I wouldn't tell you.
\n<\V[1]>So you don't know why you're immortal?

\n<\N[10]>I don't, but it seems it's inheritable.
\N[9]'s already showing early signs
of it...

\n<\V[1]>Could you tell me a bit more about the
camp?

\n<\N[10]>The camp is one of the few places where
new Magical Girls can learn the ropes
before going face to face against the
Magicos.

\n<\N[10]>I got the idea of opening the camp when
I noticed how low the average life
expectancy of new Magical Girls is.

\n<\N[10]>To create this camp, I took pieces of
many different worlds that had almost
been destroyed by the Magicos.

\n<\N[10]>I then combined them to create this
pocket plane.

\n<\N[10]>With the exception of a few portals, the
camp is a completely separated space
from the rest of the multiverse, it's the
perfect place to train.

\n<\N[10]>Well, Magicos come in all kinds of shapes
and sizes, but deep down they're all the
same.
\n<\N[10]>They're hungry, that's why they attack.
\n<\V[1]>They eat people?

\n<\N[10]>In a way. Each Magico feeds by doing
something different to its victims.

\n<\N[10]>Usually this transforms them into their
minions, which then help it find more
food, but there're also a few that literally
eat people.
\n<\V[1]>That sounds bad.
\n<\N[10]>It's worse than you think.

\n<\N[10]>If you leave a Magico alone, it will just
keep on feeding and changing people
without stopping.

\n<\N[10]>I've been to worlds where everyone was
wiped out.

\n<\N[10]>It's awful to walk through empty cities
where the only living things are the
minions they left behind.
\n<\V[1]>But where do they come from?

\n<\N[10]>Every Magico is created by Arcanos,
the first and greatest Magico.

\n<\V[1]>So if we take out Arcanos, the Magicos
will be done for?

\n<\N[10]>Do you think we didn't try it?
We sent a whole army of Magical Girls
against Arcanos.
\n<\N[10]>Only two came back.
\n<\V[1]>What do you know about Arcanos?

\n<\N[10]>It's incredibly powerful, but do you know
what's funny?

\n<\N[10]>Unlike most Magicos, it's not sapient.
Hell it's barely sentient even.

\n<\N[10]>It just creates Magicos the same way an
insect builds a really complex hive out
of instinct.

\n<\N[10]>In a way that's worse than the evil
overlord we were expecting. That thing
is like something out of a Lovecraft
novel, or a force of nature.

\n<\N[10]>You can't negotiate with it and you can
never know what it will do next.

\n<\N[10]>I started training \N[9] before
she was even ten.

\n<\N[10]>At first she didn't want to be a Magical
Girl, so sometimes... I had to be forceful.
I don't think she will ever forgive me.

\n<\N[10]>Why am I even telling you this!?
Tsk, you look so much like Evelynne, it
makes me lower my defenses.
\n<\V[1]>Who was Evelynne?
\n<\N[10]>She was \N[9]'s... father?

\n<\N[10]>It's a bit complicated.
Evelynne was a part of my team. At first
I thought she was the typical dumb valley
girl.

\n<\N[10]>Then I got to know her and I discovered
she was also a slut, and not only that,
but she also swung both ways.

\n<\N[10]>One of her powers was shape-shifting,
which suited her just fine, since it
allowed her to transform into a man to
pick up girls.
\n<\N[10]>Disgusting!

\n<\N[10]>I really hated Evelynne at first, but with
time, we became good friends.

\n<\N[10]>Anyway, back then my party consisted
of me, \N[12], Claire and Evelynne.

\n<\N[10]>Everything was perfect until we
underestimated a powerful Magico.
Claire died in that fight and Evelynne
got seriously injured.

\n<\N[10]>She spent the next couple days shape-
shifting uncontrollably until she ended
up stuck in her male form.

\n<\N[10]>We tried everything, but we simply
weren't able to restore Evelynne's magic.

\n<\N[10]>A few years later I broke a promise I
made to myself years ago and fell in
love again.
This time with male Evelynne.

\n<\N[10]>Our marriage was good until our children
were born.

\n<\N[10]>You see \N[2], a Magical Girl's
power depends on her affinity for fairy
magic, and that affinity passes down in
the family.

\n<\N[10]>The affinity of our children was off the
charts.

\n<\N[10]>I saw the possibility of creating the most
powerful soldiers that ever fought in this
damned war, but Evelynne said they
should find their own way.

\n<\N[10]>One day, she left with our children, but
\N[9], who was always the
disobedient one, ran from her father to go
to a friend's birthday.
\n<\V[1]>That's quite the story.
\n<\N[10]>Why am I telling you all of this?
\n<\V[1]>Do you feel any regret about it?

\n<\N[10]>No.
It was a small price to pay for the
millions of lives \N[9] has saved.
\n<\V[1]>Millions?

\n<\N[10]>Oh yes. \N[9] is just that powerful,
she has singlehandedly defeated Magicos
that would have given my old party
trouble.

\n<\V[1]>...
Just one more question, did you ever
find out what happened to Evelynne and
your other child?

\n<\N[10]>Yes, they died in a traffic accident.
I had \N[12] do the autopsies, she
confirmed it was them.
\n<\N[10]>See you later \N[2].

what is defined in the exception list like
that purple flame.

\n<Belle>The second is the "above" shadow. This
goes above everything except events set
to "above" or tiles marked with the *.

\n<Belle>The last is the "semi" shadow. This goes
below events that are at least "Same as
Characters", but above tiles marked "O"
or "X".

\n<Belle>It is best used for shadow edges like
over there at the opening.
You could also use it for shadow illusions.

\n<Belle>Also, hexa/penta/octagrams don't work
with the shadows because they are always
below the player, so be careful when
placing them.

"Above Characters" events.

-pictures in slots 01-50 are "below"
-pictures in slots 51-100 are "above"

\n<Entry 1>I finished building a small log cabin in this remote misty forest.

\n<Entry 1>I think I'll keep this journal to keep my sanity. I don't want to

\n<Entry 2>For the first time in my life, I'm at peace. My life here is hard 
and lonely, but I welcome it after my bloody past.

\n<Entry 37>Two peasant families have established a small farm nearby. This 
might be a problem.

\n<Entry 46>I've been helping the freemen deal with the local wildlife. They 
are a hardy bunch, but gods know they could use some skill with 
a bow.

\n<Entry 63>Joyous times! Young Alson and Eva are going to wed. I will try 
to bring down a large boar for the wedding.

\n<Entry 63>Strangely, the fog seems to be getting thicker lately, and I could 
swear I sometimes catch a faint smell of rot in the woods.
\n<Entry 63>I hope it's just my imagination.
\n<Entry 65>Today I feel somewhat sluggish and tired. I must be getting old.

\nDear diary,
I'm very happy to meet you! My name is Yvette, and I'm now a Magical Girl trainee. It's amazing to think that my old, awful life is over. Goodbye lonely old boring life, hello adventure!

\nDear diary,
Things have been tough so far, but I still have hope. A lot of the other girls here already had magic power before they arrived, so I have a lot of catching up to do.

No new friends yet, but it has only been a few days, and I'm sure things will improve soon. Just got to stay positive!

P.S. I think I found an ear in my lunch today. NOT COOL!

\nDear diary,
This place is the WORST!!! After classes today, the Director had us practice sparring with each other. Because I've never been in a fight before, I had no idea what I was doing.

I couldn't even get my wand to work. Eventually, some huge girl who looks like a valkyrie suggested I try one of her weapons: a giant metal warhammer. Somehow, that actually worked, but I hate it: it's huge and ugly and cold and way too heavy.

I hope I don't wind up with a reputation as the Blunt Weapon Magical Girl. That would be awful!

Anyway, I'm exhausted. I think I'm going to cry some more and then try to get some sleep.

\nDear diary,
Sorry if I haven't kept up writing in you as much as I planned to, but things have been crazy here! We've been doing a lot more physical training ever since the sparring sessions.

Apparently the Director thinks we're all a bunch of "scrawny little bitches," and wants us to toughen up before we go after the "Magicos." I still don't quite know what those are, but given how serious the Director is about our training, they seem scary.

I've been trying my best. The warhammer is still hard to use,
but something amazing happened the other day. The Director's
daughter, Isabelle, spent some time with me helping work
on my technique. Diary, she's the best!

\n<Diary>She's funny, she's friendly, and she's so positive! The whole time 
I've been here I've wanted to make a friend just like her, someone 
who makes me feel like I'm wanted, like I matter. After working 
with her, I almost feel like this hammer might be cool after all.

\nDear diary,
This might be a little premature, but I think I'm in LOVE! Okay, deep breaths... So this is what happened. Today was my first day of live combat, led by Ms. \N[12].

It was so scary! They brought out this awful blob thing, and had me face off against it in front of the class. I wanted to run away, but then I saw that Isabelle was watching me with this really determined look on her face. She believed in me.

When the monster charged, I froze it on the spot and whacked it
with my hammer as hard as I could! The whole fight took less
than five seconds! I never really thought of myself as a fighter
before, but...

\nThe whole class applauded me. I've never had that happen before. Afterwards, Isabelle surprised us with cupcakes! Big pink cupcakes with sprinkles on top. Everyone got one whether or not they won, but she took me aside and spoke to me, too.
"You did really great out there, Yvette! Nice work!" When Isabelle handed me my cupcake, her fingers touched mine. It was electric... and not just because she's the Lovely Lightning Witch!

Diary, I can't BELIEVE all this happened! She really is
lovely... and so popular! I hope I can keep on impressing her
during my time here.

\nDear diary,
It took some work, but I finally figured out the spell I've been working on! My Magical Girl uniform is now an icy match for Isabelle's lightning witch outfit.

My old costume was just way too childish. This new one is a lot more professional looking, and sexier too. I can't wait to wear it out during training. Isabelle is sure to notice that I've adopted her superior design.

She's been busy lately, something about a weasel Magico
causing trouble in Canada. I'm sure she'll be fine though.
There's nothing my soon-to-be-girlfriend can't do!

\nDear diary,
I don't get it.

I'm supposed to have a team of my fellow trainees, and I'm supposed to go out and beat up Magicos. Okay, fine. None of my teammates want to talk with me much, but they see how strong I am and they're willing to work together. Great.

We went out today for the third time, and finally reached the end of the circus tent dungeon we've been exploring. The Magico's minions weren't too tough at all. I probably could have cleared the place by myself, but rules are rules.

We finally found the Magico up on the trapeze platforms high
above the ground, some flying snake creature called Harlequin
Viper, I think. Whatever. My teammates nearly got killed, but
I finished it off and grabbed its core.

\nIt's been hours since then. We got home, ate some of the slop at the cafeteria, and went our separate ways. I'm in my dorm room now, candles lit, rose petals all over the bed, wearing the new lingerie \N[13] sold me.

WHERE. IS. ISABELLE!?

I passed her test! I finally went and beat a Magico! And I made it look easy! Isn't that what she wanted!?

I will be the best damn Magical Girl imaginable, if it means I'll see her smile at me again.

Must keep training.

\nDear diary,
Still no consummation of our love, but things are looking up! We were talking this afternoon about how boring things can be here at camp, and she invited me to her room for a movie!!!
I was expecting something... different, maybe a rom com, but instead she put in something called "The Noxious Avenger IV: Noxie vs. The Martians." And it was funny!

Isabelle was laughing the whole time, and that made me so happy...
Even if the movie was kind of awful. "So Bad It's Good," that's a movie genre, right? This must be one of those.

\nWe didn't kiss, but sitting on the couch together still brought us closer physically than we've ever been. Once we finished off the popcorn and cookies (my goodness, my girlfriend has such a big sweet tooth!), I was able to move closer.
I felt her warmth. Diary, my love is so very, very warm. She's like a furnace, and I just want to dive right into the heart of it. Every day I'm kept away just feels so cold...
Anyway, while she was distracted, I managed to find plenty of new trophies for the shrine. I have so much of her hair now, plus a whole bunch of nail trimmings!

It's all coming together! I can't wait to take her up there and
show her how much I care.

\nDear diary,
A new girl arrived at camp today, some awkward ugly girl. The weird thing is, she and Isabelle are already hanging out like old friends! That is NOT how things work around here.

No one gets to spend time with my Isabelle until I have
investigated them and made sure they're worthy. Whoever this
bitch is, she is NOT going to just skip ahead like that. Not on
my watch.

\nDear diary,
What the fuck is this girl's deal!? The new girl, \N[2], is already defeating Magicos. She just obliterated the old camp record!

Isabelle is spending even more time around her now. I've seen my darling take time out to help those in need, but she never goes out of her way this much. Could it be that this flat-chested skank has impressed her!?

It took me more than a month to beat a Magico. I guess I'd find
her impressive, too.

\nFuck.
Fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck

fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck 
fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck 
fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck fu-\V[15]

The rest of the page continues like this for some time before
devolving into red, angry scribbles. The next page seems much
calmer.

\nI've been trying harder to get my look just right. Cosmetic magic isn't that hard to come by around here, but I think I might be at the limits of what my body can handle. I'm still not perfect for my perfect darling.
I clearly need to work harder.

\nDear diary,
My enemy is a sadistic cunt.
I knew she was awful, but I didn't think she'd even noticed me yet. It's hard to believe she'd go out of her way to make her hatred of me personal so soon. I underestimated what she was capable of.

Today I found the journal of one of the other girls in camp, that little goblin weirdo who tagged along when I killed my Magico. \N[2] left it in my caves, along with a ton of that gross lemonade the goblin girl loves.

I read it, and nothing in it made any sense, not really. It all just
seemed like pointless girly stuff. But then I realized what she
was saying. In all that boring garbage, the happiest times she
wrote about were the times when she was with Isabelle.

\nTraining together, telling jokes, being such good friends...

The timing's too perfect. \N[2] left it for me to find, just to tell me that the world will never let me have Isabelle all to myself. She'll always have little flies buzzing around.

Distracting her from what's important, drowning out how much I love her.
Buzz buzz buzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz!!!

I drank one of the lemonades before realizing they were probably poison. But no, they were only nasty, sour soda. A fitting gift from a nasty, sour bitch. I drank them all just to show that her stupid prank won't deter me.
Afterwards, I tore the diary to pieces. It felt good to rip it up.

\nI don't think \N[2] found my shrine; everything still seemed to be in place. Even so, I moved it deeper into the ruins, just in case.

Isabelle and \N[2].

Never gonna happen.

I'll get rid of the flies eventually, but first I need to bury the bloated, rotting carcass getting them all so excited.

I should get back to my training.

\nWHAT IS THIS BITCH'S DEAL!?

NO ONE beats Magicos like this. No one except Isabelle.
This freak has to be cheating!

And cheaters must be punished.

\nI don't care if she's the ugliest girl in camp.
(She is.)
I don't care if she surrounds herself with sad, washed-up rejects.
(She does.)

\n<Diary>I remember how she looked when she first arrived here. She
was a homely mess. She must think she's being subtle with her
magical upgrades, but I see right through her.

\n<Diary>I remember how she looked when she first arrived here. She
was a homely mess. Now this fake fake FAKER is so pretty and
perfect she makes me SICK!

\n<Diary>Worst of all, she actually had her face redesigned to resemble

Seeing my love's smile on this whore makes me sick to my

\nEnough is enough.
It's time I start taking direct action, before she poisons Isabelle's heart against me even more. I'll start small and see if that does the trick before trying anything drastic.

But one way or another, I will make this bitch wish she had
never been born.

You have long since replaced the bright, confident
young man with someone shy, effeminate, and
completely absent-minded.

Fortunately, you are there to support him.
Buying a home far from everyone who ever knew him
is easy for you, as is getting him a new identity.

And since neither of you need to work, nothing
interrupts you from training him.

You cannot say how you know who Nathan needs to be,
but you know all the same.
Each day you use your magic to change him closer
and closer to perfection.

Blonde hair.
Blue eyes.
An innocent laugh.
Enormous breasts.
The list goes on and on.

He no longer fights the changes, but welcomes them,
knowing that you love him, that you know best.
And one day...

\n<\V[1]>So you knew her?

\n<Nele>I knew of her. Back before the courts settled their differences 
and joined forces, she was something of a pest in Unseelie 
politics. Loud, self-righteous, and dead-set against the truce.

\n<Nele>When it finally happened despite her complaints, her royal family 
was one of the first to go into exile rather than submit to it.

\n<Nele>I was worried that the Seelie would have an overwhelming say 
in how things proceed, simply on account of their greater 
numbers. Then I discovered that plenty of their families made 
the same choice.

\n<Nele>Maybe there's not much of a difference between the fairy courts 
after all, huh?

\n<\V[1]>That reminds me... While I was in there, I saw a painting of the 
royal court, and there was a fairy in it that looked an awful lot 
like you.

\n<\V[1]>Maybe a little taller and lot less friendly, but the resemblance 
was impossible to miss.

\n<Nele>...That would probably be my sister, Ancelin. I shouldn't be 
surprised she'd work with that crowd.

\n<Nele>Growing up, she was always the family favourite. Smart, 
pretty, funny... It's not like our parents didn't care about 
me, but it was easy to see who the preferred daughter was.
\n<Nele>But then, as she grew up, my sister revealed her true colours.

\n<Nele>She and I both worked side jobs while we were teenagers to 
help cover family expenses. The only difference is that I gave 
my parents everything, and she hid every lume she could.

\n<Nele>But what's really unforgivable is how she disappeared one day 
after stealing every valuable in the house! We were devastated.
\n<\V[1]>Nele, that's horrible! How did your family recover?

\n<Nele>Slowly. We never saw her again after that. Mother and father just 
accepted she was trying to make it on her own, and trusted she'd 
come back some day.

\nAnd now I know that that stuck-up, soulless bitch has been partying it up with some of the worst people in the multiverse.
It makes me just want to grab a hot iron poker and ram it right up her big fat-\V[15]

\n<\V[1]>Oh no! We were completely beaten.
\n<\V[1]>(I'm tired... I should go to bed.)

The notes read:
The bestiary records all enemies you naturally encounter. Killing an enemy will provide a description of that enemy.

The bestiary will also attempt to determine an enemy's abilities if they are put to the test:
-Attacking them may reveal their defences, while getting hit by them may reveal their strength

In short: go and kill things to fill it out.
- Melancia :)

The notes read:
The Scan Scope, if used on a highlighted enemy by pressing Shift, will reveal that enemy's attributes, such as its strength or magical aptitude.

It will also reveal their defences against various elements
or status effects.

When combined with a bestiary, the Scan Scope will fill out all
statistics on an enemy immediately, so use it to study
enemies and exploit their weaknesses.

Some enemies might be able to fool the Scan Scope
regarding their true powers or cause an error.

Note that since it is a prototype, there might be unforeseen
errors.
(Sorry, still trying to fix those^^' - Melancia)

Somehow the core absorbs the physical residue of the dead person and then transforms into a Magico in their image.
